intro: Libanothamnus occultus subsp. oroquensis, commonly known as the Oroquen shrub, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate to subtropical climates. Its small, clustered flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Due to habitat loss, this subspecies is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
